Installation¶

The latest stable version is available on PyPI. Alternatively, you can build the development version.

Quick install¶

To get the latest stable release and required dependencies, run the following as root:

pip install pysurvey

Python version support¶

Python 2.6 to 2.7. Currently, Python 3 is not supported.

Dependencies¶

  • pandas: 0.8.0 or higher.

Recommended Dependencies¶

  • matplotlib: required for plotting
  • SciPy: miscellaneous statistical functions. Required for distances and hierarchical clustering

Optional dependencies¶

  • scikits-learn: machine learning tool such as: Gaussian mixture models, etc’
  • pycognet: required for PCoA
  • rpy2: required for using R functions

Note

While it is possible to install PySurvey with only the required dependency, many useful features require the recommended/optional dependencies. Hence, it is highly recommended that you install these. Since installing these packages (as well as pandas dependecies) can become challenging, a distribution such as the Enthought Python Distribution may be worth considering.

Installing from source¶

The source code is hosted at <https://bitbucket.org/yonatanf/pysurvey. To retrieve the package and install it locally do (root permissions may be required):

hg clone https://bitbucket.org/yonatanf/pysurvey
cd pysurvey
python setup.py install

Running the test suite¶

Though the test suite is not currently provide exhaustive coverage, most of the common operations are coverage. Running the test suite requires nose, and is done by running:

$ nosetests pysurvey
